attributes.description: These are the indigenous human and societal resources coflict.org used in the compilation of its universal SCD pattern taxonomy. We used a methodology based on a combination of system dynamics simulations, socio-cultural systems anthropology collection methods, abductive reasoning, and Bayesian statistics in the formulation.
attributes.title: Socio-Cultural Dynamics Patterns

attributes.description:
Pompeii, Naples and environs, Capri.
Tourism related to local and global economies;history and tourism;traditional southern European family upbringing and cultural/educational imperatives;education, business, politics; Italian-American interactions.
attributes.title: History and Society

attributes.description:
Sabi Sands, locally-managed and authentic (no salt-licks to attract the "big five") game reserve; Mala Mala corporate game reserve, site of the 1999 Sports Illustrated swimsuit issue shoot.
DAT Experiments: Local economy and sustainability;Boer-British-Zulu-Xhosa-Sotho interactions, cultural imperatives and business ;ethnicity and roles in business and local politics;infrastructure and planning in a mixed economy.
attributes.title: Biosphere Sustainability

attributes.description:
Manistique, Indian Lake and environs. Rural, fishing and hunting; unique Upper-Peninsula sub-culture.
DAT Experiments: "Yooper" sub-culture priorities and beliefs;hunting and fishing biosphere sustainability;animal-human relations;local vs tourist cultural conflict; education and economy.
attributes.title: Economy and Rural Life

attributes.description:
Amsterdam, Rotterdam, rural Holland
DAT Experiments; Social policy and cultural conflict; agricultural production impact on local culture;manufacturing and Dutch society; education and European business influence; history and ethic identification;biosphere and production sustainability;engineering vs biosphere in saltwater intrusion.
attributes.title: Society and Business

attributes.description:
Harare, a transitional capital city with an interesting sub-culture;route to Bulawayo and Troutbeck.
DAT Experiments: Local and national politics vs business operations;British-African business and cultural relations as historical artifact; Shona-Ndbele inter-relations;post-UDI conflict and resolution;traditional culture vs global economy; local business vs global economy; agriculture and ethnic competition; politics and ethnicity.
attributes.title: Conflict and Politics

attributes.description:
Hwange Game Reserve
DAT Experiments: Sustainability and tourism; animal-human interaction and cultural patterns;European-American-African inter-relations and cultural imperatives;local adaptations to global economy.
attributes.title: Biosphere and Sustainability

attributes.description:
Miami proper, Miami Beach, South Beach.
DAT Experiments: Tourism and the local economy; Cuban-Black-Latino-gringo inter-relations in business and society; leisure economy and its impact on arts and entertainment; cuisine and music's cross-cultural influence; architecture and planning in zoning and ethnic politics.
-acter1
attributes.title: Tourism

attributes.description:
Bell Timber Corporation; logging and milling; Italian-African.
DAT experiments: Italian-American-African cultural and business relations;Krahn-Gio-Mandinga relations affecting business operations;biosphere and environment;first-world vs third world resource competition; market vs environment; business elite vs worker; technology vs tropical conditions;
attributes.title: Biosphere Extraction

attributes.description:
Wohlert Corporation; gears and wheels manufacturer; moved operations to Mexico;bomb rings for Vietnam war;Ford tractor and truck engine blocks;AFL-CIO.
DAT Experiments: Union-management relations;union worker culture;German immigrant narrative;global business vs local manufacturing;civil rights policy vs business operations;politics and local business;hiring preference and access.
attributes.title: Local Manufacturing

attributes.description:
Wang Laboratories;Lowell computer and software linchpin;now defunct; buildings re-purposed to office space.
DAT Experiments: Chinese sub-culture inter-relations - Shanghai, Taiwanese, Cantonese, Hong Kong, American-born; Chinese immigrant narrative;technology over-reach;product (manufacturing) vs service priorities;mid-size business and global economy; hedgehog vs capital expansion;nepotism and business leadership.
attributes.title: Technology

attributes.description:
Lone Star Shipping; French-African corporation;historical consequence; 
DAT experiments:French-Danish-WestAfrican-Swiss cultural and business interaction;diamond smuggling and local-global business operation;tribal consolidation of business sub-culture;Kru-Grebo-Wolof tribal interactions;
attributes.title: Stevedoring/Shipping

attributes.description:
Dallas-Fort Worth mid-point. American transitional city.
DAT Experiments: Cuisine as cultural imperative (beef barbecue vs pork, tex-mex vs authentic Mexican);confluence of American Southern-Western-Northern subcultures in urban and rural settings;biosophere sustainability and meat production;Mexican-gringo inter-relations;local politics and Rangers Park.
attributes.title: Tex-Mex

attributes.address: Okemos, Meridian Charter Township, MI, USA
attributes.title: Upper-class Midwestern Town

attributes.description:
Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands; Charlotte Amalie High School; Magen's Bay
DAT Experiments: Ethnic inter-relations in education and business;tourism and local economy;biosphere sustainability;politics in a colonial setting;education vs economic outcomes; history and perception;British and US colonial development parallels and gaps.
-acter1
attributes.address: Charlotte Amalie, St Thomas 00802, Virgin Islands
attributes.title: Education and Colonization

attributes.description:
Tomato fields of Dixon (Galindo Farms); UCalifornia at Davis; San Joaquin Valley.
DAT Experiments: Immigrant culture vs business;Mexican-gringo interactions; agriculture and desertification; biosphere sustainability, irrigation technology;politics and water supply;academia and agriculture technology.
attributes.title: Agriculture and Immigration

attributes.description:
Mid-Rand, Joburg proper, Sandtown Mall
DAT Experiments: Ethnic relations in business, politics, and education;technology transfer and cultural priorities;perception and conflict; historical and cultural framing and filters.
attributes.title: Society, Politics, History

attributes.description:
Technology and business center.
DAT Experiments; Urban vs rural impacts on culture and economy; infrastructure, planning and budget priorities;global economy vs local sustainability;Indian-American interactions;technology and knowledge transfer and its impact on local and global education.
-acter1
attributes.title: Business and Society

attributes.description:
Corporate headquarters, central Tokyo, poor areas of Koenji and Nakano, Roppongi, bullet train, Hotel Okura.
Issues of women's status, foreign interaction with Japanese, Japanese technology, business process, after-hours business interaction, Western influence on Japanese youth culture, food preparation and dining, Japanese influence on Western food, American-Japanese relations and cultural interactions.
-acter1
attributes.title: Business and Technology

attributes.description:
Les Halles, all Arondissements, Rive Gauche, etc.
DAT Experiments: French-American inter-relations; culture and politics; inter-society arts and cuisine;politics and immigration;global economy impact on local and national business.
attributes.title: Society and Arts

attributes.description: Urban high school of about 2200 students in Monrovia, with attendees spanning tribal and Western upbringing, influenced by both African and American culture, with a combination of Liberian, other West African, and both white and black Peace Corps teachers.
attributes.title: Education and History
Cultural Relations
attributes.description:
The Rainbow Inn and the hostel in town. Also at the Falls themselves, with their midnight rainbows and boatrides down the lower Zambezi.
DAT experiments with Ndebele and Shona, Norwegians, Germans, Japanese, British, and New Zealanders. Parallax view and cloaked identity.
Patterns: African-European-Asian-American cultural interaction;environmental commons versus basic needs;African inter-tribal relations;African vs European business process and culture;ecosystem variances;indigenous vs transitional culture and priorities.

attributes.title: Business and Education
attributes.description:
Manila and environs; Cebu; Dumaguete; Borocua; Tagaytay; Meralco Foundation; offshoot of national power company and their endowment;technical training for financially-challenged students in economic areas of need, such as engines, electricity, shipping, etc.
DAT experiments: American-Pilipino interactions; American-Pilipino history, politics and military and business relations; Chinese-Tagalog ethnic interactions in politics and business; biosphere sustainability and agricultural methods; aquatic seafood farms vs business economy; education and cultural influence; global shipping and local economy; planning and transportation in developing urban areas.
-acter1
